description:
Majority of schema modification functions now return new, altered schemas rather than modifying the original schema in place.

Affected functions: 
- addResolversToSchema
- attachDirectiveResolvers
- addSchemaLevelResolver
- addCatchUndefinedToSchema
- addErrorLoggingToSchema
- addMocksToSchema

Remote schema wrapping is now accomplished by using executors and subscribers rather than fetchers and links. Functions that convert links to executors/subscribers are included with @graphql-tools/links. See the docs.

mergeInfo in GraphQLResolveInfo has been replaced by stitchingInfo in GraphQLSchemas extensions.

info.mergeInfo.mergedTypes -> schema.extensions.stichingInfo.mergedTypes
info.mergeInfo.delegate -> ??
info.mergeInfo.fragments -> ??
info.mergeInfo.replacementSelectionSets -> schema.extensions.selectionSetByType
info.mergeInfo.replacementFragments -> ??

The case where a FieldTransformer previously returned an { name: string, field: GraphQLFieldConfig<any, any> } will now result in an array instead [string, GraphQLFieldConfig<any, any>] instead of an object.
The affected functions are:
- TransformRootFields
- TransformObjectFields

Field transformer callback functions now take a GraphQLFieldConfig instead of a GraphQLField.

The affected functions are:
TransformRootFields
FilterRootFields
RenameRootFields
TransformObjectFields
FilterObjectFields
RenameObjectFields
Custom proxying resolvers take an options object instead of individual parameters.
delegateToSchema is not available in mergeInfo or stitchingInfo anymore. Simply import the delegateToSchema function from the delegate package instead.
Polyfills for graphql versions earlier than 14.2 have been removed, including toConfig
fieldToFieldConfig and inputFieldToInputFieldConfig functionality is now exported separately, although library users should ideally not have to use them.
